mods.note: I.r n / \j i â€” CJ tAPr: o ijb; The Under Secretary of State for India presents his compliments to the Under Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs, and, in continuation of the communication from this Office of the 8th instant, begs to transmit herewith 4 parcels containing the original files of the German Consulate at Bushire relating to the Abu Musa Oxide concession. India Office, 12th April 1916.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: File 4919/1912 Pt 2 'Abu Musa Oxide Concession: transmission of original files of German Consulate at Bushire'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the volume

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 3; these numbers are printed or written in pencil, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file consists of file notes and a letter, dated 12 April 1916, from the Under Secretary of State for India to the Under Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs which accompanied four parcels of original files of the German consulate at Bushire relating to the Abu Musa Oxide concession. The notes on the front of the file consist of a query (dated, 15 April 1916) as to whether it is necessary to read through the papers and the reply (dated, 17 April 1916) that it could wait until the end of the war, when the question could be resolved.

name.namePart: Permanent Under-Secretary of State for India
Permanent Under-Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs
